the Precision of a watch is a function
of its movement for Rolex and for Hans
wiof to guarantee the Precision of a
Time piece the pressing question was how
to protect the movement itself from the
elements not only water but also tiny
particles of dust in 1926 a major step
was taken with the creation of the
world's first waterproof and dustproof
wristwatch the Rolex Oyster was
born over the years subtle changes in
the design continued to improve the
oyster adding more Comfort while keeping
the style
contemporary and along with style more
functions have been added a Rolex
wristwatch was the first to show the
date through a small aperture on the
face it was also the first wristwatch to
spell out the day of the week in
full
in the early 1950s Rolex developed
professional watches whose functions
went far beyond telling the time
launched in 1953 the Submariner was the
first Rolex watch guaranteed waterproof
to a depth of 330
ft already on an incredible journey of
innovation and design Rolex decided to
push the boundaries even
further in 1960 the bathy scav triest
and Rolex made history the submersible
successfully dived to
35,800 Ft below the surface of the ocean
a Rolex deep sea special was strapped to
the
outside the development of undersea
exploration led to the launching in 1967
of the sea dweller 2000 waterproof to a
depth of 2,000
ft in 2008 the Submariner in gold is red
designed and the case features a new
unidirectional rotatable bezel with a
cerrome
disc fitted with the patented Rolex ring
lock system the Rolex deep sea safely
descends to
